intro: Stachys aculeolata, commonly known as the spiked hedge nettle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, purple to pink flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Stachys aculeolata is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
